III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was speaking about explicit topics to include sex with
other youth over the past weekend. There is a concern that there
was no staff supervision during this time. Youth A claims to be
watching sexual content on the phone while on visits with a worker
present.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
09/09/2024.
Complainant was anonymous.
Foster Care Worker (FCW) was interviewed via telephone on
09/09/2024. FCW reported Youth A was placed at the facility on
09/03/2024 and she has not visited Youth A at his current
placement. She said Youth A has a history of sexualized behavior.
She reported there has been no incident reports regarding Youth
A for the past weekend and she has no concerns for staff
supervision.
Director was interviewed on 09/13/2024 at the facility. Director
reported he is not aware of any incident from the past weekend
involving Youth A. He said Youth A did not have any visits with his
worker or any other person last week. Director said youths do not
have access to phones or computers, so he denied Youth A would
have had access to use a cell phone.
Therapist was interviewed on 09/13/2024 at the facility. Youth A
was placed at the facility on 09/03/2024. Therapist said there is
only one incident that occurred in the classroom involving Youth
A, she received an email on 9/11/2024 stating Youth A was
making inappropriate moaning noises and hand gestures towards
Youth B. She met with Youth A addressed the incident,
boundaries, and revised his safety plan. Staff are instructed to
2

keep Youth A and Youth B separated and to redirect Youth A
when he does anything inappropriate. She is not aware of any
other incident or concerns regarding staff supervision, or Youth A
having access to a phone. Youth A is scheduled to see the
psychiatrist on 09/16/2024.
Youth A was interviewed on 09/13/2024 at the facility. Youth A is
13 years old. He has been at the facility for one week. Youth A
denied having access to a phone, watching anything
inappropriate, or making sexual remarks to anyone. He said he
does not like talking about “sex” and requested to stop asking him
questions. Youth A denied any concerns regarding staff
supervision.
Youth B was interviewed on 09/13/2024 at the facility. Youth B is
15 years old and has been at the facility for one month. Youth B
reported all his needs are being met, and he feels safe. Youth B
reported there was one incident involving Youth A making
inappropriate comments a few days ago. He reported the incident
to staff. Youth B reported staff were supervising and they
redirected Youth A. Youth B denied having access to a phone or
witnessing Youth A using a cell phone or watching anything on a
cell phone.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were interviewed on 09/13/2024 at the facility.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 worked with Youth A the weekend of
09/07/2024 and 09/08/2024. Staff 1 and Staff 2 both denied any
incidents involving Youth A speaking inappropriately or having
access to a phone. Staff 1 and Staff 2 reported Youth A was being
supervised at all times.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A safety plan dated 09/04/2024: Safety concerns
Youth A sexually assaulted a youth at his previous
placement. Youth A may become physically aggressive
towards others when dysregulated. Staff should always
supervise the youth during activity and never leave alone
with another youth. Youth should always remain in eyesight
of staff.
• Youth A safety plan revised on 09/11/2024. Youth A is to
be separated from Youth B at all times until further notice.
Youth A and Youth B have been informed of this
information.
• Children’s Village policy for staff to resident ratio and
supervision of residents. The ratio of direct care workers to
youth placed at Mandy’s Place is 1:2 during normal awake
3

hours and 1:8 during sleep hours. Youth Specialist will
provide vigilant supervision of the youth in their care at all
times. Vigilant supervision as being watchful, active, awake
and alert.
• Email to Therapist dated 09/11/2024, Youth B reported
Youth A made an inappropriate moaning noise, and
inappropriate hand gestures towards Youth B.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews and documentation reviewed, there is insufficient
evidence to support the allegations.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
